comment: captures cases like 'tumour: No', hence short distance. Previously had '([\w\(\)]+ ){,5}([\w\(\)]+){,1}: (no|none|negative)' but it is possible to make empty spaces automatically flexible in subsequent processing
e.g. 'known tumour' but not 'prior therapy for tumour'
when side=both, do not specify ex_left and ex_right as it leads to unexpected results
e.g. presumed, presumable, presuming, suggestive, suggesting, suggested, ...
e.g. can limit the scope of 'no' if followed by 'but' in 'no X detected, but Y is present
e.g. can nullify the scope of 'no' if followed by 'cause for' in 'no cause identified for tumour
e.g. can nullify the scope of 'free of' if preceded by 'not' in 'not free of tumour'
e.g. can nullify the scope of 'no' if followed by 'change' in 'no change in tumour'
e.g. helps to apply 'history' for X and not Y in 'history of X, presenting with Y'

pat: (consistent with|compatible with|in line with|in keeping with|typical of|confirmation of|with evidence of|with|conclusion|impression)
